suncertify.db.spec
Interface LockManager<K,C>

Type Parameters:
K - Key type
C - Cookie type
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseLockManagerImpl, DefaultLockManagerImpl
public interface LockManager<K,C>

The LockManager provides unified management for a keyed collection of locks.

Version:
1.0 27/09/2010
Author:
Ignacio del Valle Alles

Method Summary
 boolean isValidCookie(K lockKey, C cookie)
          Tests if the cookie is valid for that key.
 C lock(K lockKey)
          Acquires the lock corresponding to the specified key and returns a cookie that must be used in order to release the lock.
 void unlock(K lockKey, C cookie)
          Releases the corresponding lock.
 

Method Detail

lock

C lock(K lockKey)
Acquires the lock corresponding to the specified key and returns a cookie that must be used in order to release the lock. If the resolving lock is already owned, the current thread gives up the CPU and consumes no CPU cycles until the lock is released.

Parameters:
lockKey - the locking key identifying the lock.
Returns:
the cookie needed to perform the unlocking.
See Also:
unlock(K lockKey, C cookie)

unlock

void unlock(K lockKey,
            C cookie)
            throws SecurityException
Releases the corresponding lock.

Parameters:
lockKey - the locking key identifying the lock.
cookie - the value returned in lock acquisition.
Throws:
SecurityException - if the cookie supplied does not match the value returned at locking time.
See Also:
lock(K lockKey)

isValidCookie

boolean isValidCookie(K lockKey,
                      C cookie)
Tests if the cookie is valid for that key.

Parameters:
lockKey - the locking key identifying the lock.
cookie - the cookie value to validate.
Returns:
true if the entity was locked and returned that cookie. Otherwise returns false.
